intro: Licania maguirei, commonly known as the Guatemalan licania, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
